titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Carleen Hutchins papers M1734
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Andrea Castillo

publicationstmt.publisher: Stanford University. Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-10-17T12:18-0700

did.unittitle: Carleen Hutchins papers

repository.corpname: Stanford University. Department of Special Collections and University Archives

physdesc.extent: (83 manuscript boxes; 2 flat boxes; 3 map folders, and 1 oversize item)

did.abstract: The papers relate primarily to musical acoustics, musical instrument construction, and her invention of the violin octet including research notes and papers; research notebooks; manuscript and published articles; lectures and lecture notes; charts, graphs, and drawings relating to musical instruments and acoustics; correspondence; photographs and slides; posters; and sound recordings on tape and cassette comprising 33 boxes.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Carleen Hutchins Papers were a gift of Joseph McNalley and the Hutchins Consort, 2010. Accession 2010-011.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

processinfo.head: Processing note
processinfo.p: Records were processed with help from Center for Computer Research in Music and Acoustics (CCRMA), Stanford Institute for Creativity and the Arts (SiCA) and the Violin Society of America. Collection was processed by Andrea Castillo, August 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carleen Hutchins Papers M1734 Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Hutchins Collections consisting of 40.58 linear feet, spanning from the 1940s to 2009, documents Carleen Hutchins career through papers, research notes, clippings, photographs, correspondence, and media materials. Of particular importance are her notebooks where she recorded many of her acoustical experiments and the details on the construction of new instruments.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Hutchins Papers are arranged in 7 series: Series 1. Notebooks Series 2. General Files Series 3. Research and Writings Series 4. Other Authors’ Research and Writings Series 5. Photographic Materials Series 6. Media Series 7. Posters

relatedmaterial.head: Related archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related to the Musical Acoustics Research Library (MARL) Records, M1711.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Notebooks: Data on Existing Stringed Instruments and on the Construction of New Ones

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carleen Hutchins’ notebooks records work done on existing stringed instruments and, most importantly, the creation of new instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carleen Hutchins’ General Files contain mainly her correspondence with instrument builders, acousticians, engineers, chemists, musical performers, in particular string players, and other business-related acquaintances.
